ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Real world application of the methods taught throughout the S&DS Major.
End to end data science project lifecycle, experience with different models, data collection and exploration.
I learned more about the process required for data science. In classes we typically learn about the theory, but here we practiced the application of these methods.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Professor Brian Macdonald made this course phenomenal. The case studies he chose and the friendly environment he created for the class made sure that every student was able to take away real world applications of data science despite the varying level of experience in the course.

This course was amazing. The collaborative environment allowed me to learn a lot of know ledge and skills from my peers. It taught me how to do data science in a more industry setting. Brian is extremely knowledgeable and gives very helpful advice for when youre stuck.

Brian is awesome and it is great to get practice working with data in a real work setting. I think there should be more structure in the course, potentially some lecturing, and more feedback throughout the course.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely. This course was very interesting, educational, and Brian Macdonald is a fantastic professor.

Absolutely! This course is great for students who will be moving on to do data science in an industry setting. I didnt have a strong senior project idea so I decided to take case studies, and I believe I made the right decision. S&DS course are typically lectures and this course I was able to get know my peers and learn a lot from them.
Yes, it was a good course and nice to have a seminar as a senior. I think there should be more seminars in the S&DS department.
